alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:41AM EST until December 21 at 4:46PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Skowhegan. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Water up to the bottom of the Margaret Chase Smith bridge in Skowhegan. Road closures are expected with significant travel disruptions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Tuesday the flow was 28,493.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 159,030.0 cfs this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood flow is 35,000.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
